metadata.description: Name of the Event Hub Namespace.
SKU of the Event Hub Namespace. Possible values are "Basic" or "Standard" or "Premium
Event Hubs throughput units for Basic or Standard tiers where value should be 0 to 20 units. For Premium tier, value should be 0 to 10 premium units.
Enabling this property creates a Standard Event Hubs Namespace in regions supported availability zones.
Whether to enable AutoInflate or not.
Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled.
Whether to enable Kafka or not.
Whethere tp disable SAS authentication or not.
Whether to enable public network access or not.
Set the minimum TLS version for the Event Hub Namespace.
Name of the namespace authorization rule.
The rights associated with the rule.
The eventhub namespace name.
The eventhub name. Optional if the authorization rule is for namespace and not for an eventhub.
Name of the namespace role assignment.
The description of the role assignment.
The principal ids associated with the role assignment.
The principal type associated with the role assignment.
The role definition id or name associated with the role assignment.
The eventhub namespace name.
Name of the namespace role assignment.
The description of the role assignment.
The principal ids associated with the role assignment.
The principal type associated with the role assignment.
The role definition id or name associated with the role assignment.
Name of the namespace disaster recovery config.
The resource id of the secondary partner namespace, which is part of GEO DR pairing.
The eventhub namespace name.
Name of the Event Hub.
The eventhub namespace name.
Number of partitions created for the Event Hub, allowed values are from 1 to 32 partitions.
Number of days to retain the events for this Event Hub, value should be 1 to 7 days.
A value that indicates whether capture description is enabled.
TEnumerates the possible values for the encoding format of capture description.
The time window allows you to set the frequency with which the capture to Azure Blobs will happen, value should between 60 to 900 seconds.
The size window defines the amount of data built up in your Event Hub before an capture operation, value should be between 10485760 to 524288000 bytes.
A value that indicates whether to Skip Empty Archives
The eventhub capture destination name.
Blob naming convention for archive, e.g. {Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}.
The eventhub capture description destination blob container name.
TSubscription Id of Azure Data Lake Store
The Azure Data Lake Store name for the captured events
The destination folder path for the captured events
Subscription Id of Azure Data Lake Store
The role assignements scoped to event hub.
The possible values for the status of the Event Hub..
Name of the Event Hub Consumer Group.
The eventhub namespace name.
The eventhub name.
The user metadata.
Name of the namespace diagnostic setting.
The eventhub namespace name.
The log analytics workspace id.
The storage account id.
The eventhub name.
The eventhub authorization rule id.
The list of metic settings.
The list of logs settings.
A value indicating whether this category is enabled.
The category of the metrics.
The time grain of the metric in ISO8601 format.
The retention policy of the metric.
The retention period of the metric.
The retention policy enabled flag.
A value indicating whether this log is enabled.
The category of the logs.
The category group of the logs.
The retention policy of the logs.
The name of the private endpoint.
The eventhub namespace name.
The subnet that the private endpoint should be created in.
The subresource name of the target Azure resource that private endpoint will connect to.
The ID of the private DNS zone in which private endpoint will register its private IP address.
When set to true, users will need to manually approve the private endpoint connection request.
Tags for the resource.
Optional. Name for the Event Hub cluster, Alphanumerics and hyphens characters, Start with letter, End with letter or number.
Optional. The quantity of Event Hubs Cluster Capacity Units contained in this cluster.
Required. Location for all resources.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Required. The list of the event hub namespaces with its configurations to be created.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Event Hub Namespace.
Optional. Role assignments for the namespace.
Optional. The disaster recovery config for the namespace.
Optional. The Diagnostics Settings config for the namespace.
Optional. Name for the eventhub with its all configurations to be created.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Event Hub .
Optional. consumer groups for the Event Hub .
Private Endpoints that should be created for Azure EventHub Namespaces.
